body.p: A study was conducted in order to explore the relationship between the number of beers a person drinks and his/her blood alcohol content (BAC, in %).
This study is an example of which role-type classification?

response.feedback: Not quite right. We are exploring how the number of beers affects BAC. You are correct that the response variable, BAC, is quantitative. Is the explanatory variable categorical or quantitative?
Incorrect. We are exploring how the number of beers affects BAC. Decide which is the explanatory variable and which is the response variable. Then decide whether each is categorical or quantitative.
Correct. Both the explanatory (number of beers) and response (BAC) variables are quantitative in this case, and therefore this is an example of case Q→Q.

Not quite right. We are exploring how the number of beers affects BAC. You are correct that the explanatory variable, number of beers, is quantitative. Is the explanatory variable categorical or quantitative?

part.hint: The two relevant variables here are number of beers and blood alcohol content (BAC). Determine the role-type classification for these two variables.
